text: Between faith and unbelief is abandoning the prayer.
None of you will have faith till he wishes for his (Muslim) brother what he likes for himself.
Abusing a Muslim is Fusuq (an evil doing) and killing him is Kufr (disbelief).
Whoever (intentionally) ascribes to me what I have not said then (surely) let him occupy his seat in Hell-fire.
Whoever (intentionally) ascribes to me what I have not said then (surely) let him occupy his seat in Hell-fire.
He who is not merciful to others, will not be treated mercifully.
The strong is not the one who overcomes the people by his strength, but the strong is the one who controls himself while in anger.
Make things easy for the people, and do not make it difficult for them, and make them calm (with glad tidings) and do not repulse (them )
Allah will not be merciful to those who are not merciful to mankind.

(The following are) two words (sentences or utterances) that are very easy for the tongue to say, and very heavy in the balance (of reward), and most beloved to the Gracious Almighty (And they are): سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
The world is a prison-house for a believer and Paradise for a non-believer.
Never did the family of Muhammad (ﷺ) eat to the fill the bread of barley for two successive days until Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) died.
